revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox military person |name= Mustafizur Rahman |birth_date= [[Rangpur District|Rangpur]], [[East Pakistan]] |death_date= |birth_place= |death_place=[[Dhaka]] |placeofburial= |image= |caption= |width= |nickname= |allegiance=[[Bangladesh]] |branch=[[Bangladesh Army]] |serviceyears= |rank= [[General]] |commands= |unit= |battles= |awards= |religion= |laterwork= }} '''Mustafizur Rahman''' was a Bangladeshi Army officer who served as the [[Chief of Army Staff of the Bangladesh Army]] from 24 December 1997 â€“ 23 December 2000.
==Early life== Mustafizur Rahman was born in [[Rangpur District|Rangpur]], [[East Pakistan]].<ref name="bdd">{{cite book|last1=Rahman|first1=Syedur|title=Historical dictionary of Bangladesh|date=2010|publisher=Scarecrow Press|location=Lanham, MD|isbn=0810874539|pages=242|edition=4th|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bJfcCPUr0OoC&pg=PA242&lpg=PA242&dq=%22general+mustafizur+rahman%22&source=bl&ots=PT5tFtCu4U&sig=3Y3wsFIWHo6oXlKLBa9tgUkFJYU&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiC4ZOzuYTLAhVENz4KHcEiBMsQ6AEIOzAF#v=onepage&q=%22general%20mustafizur%20rahman%22&f=false}}</ref>
==Career== He fought in [[Bangladesh Liberation War]] and was awarded [[Bir Protik]] by the Government of Bangladesh.<ref name="bdd" /> He was wounded in action on November 1971. He would serve General officer commanding of an infantry 19th Division (Mymensingh) and principal staff officer of Bangladesh army.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bangladesh names new army chief|url=http://gulfnews.com/news/uae/general/bangladesh-names-new-army-chief-1.437164|website=gulfnews.com|accessdate=19 February 2016}}</ref> He served as the Army chief of Bangladesh from December 1997 to December 2000.<ref name="bdd" /> In 2004 the [[Bangladesh Nationalist party]] government tried to demote him post retirement from General to Lieutenant General and accused that his promotion was a result of his undue influence on the previous [[Bangladesh Awami League]] government.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ex-army chief Mustafiz loses his four-star general rank|url=http://archive.thedailystar.net/2004/10/12/d4101201075.htm|website=archive.thedailystar.net|publisher=The Daily Star|accessdate=19 February 2016}}</ref> [[Bangladesh High Court]] nullified the government order.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stripping ex-army chief Mustafizur Rahman of rank illegal: HC|url=http://bdnews24.com/politics/2008/02/19/stripping-ex-army-chief-mustafizur-rahman-of-rank-illegal-hc|website=bdnews24.com|accessdate=19 February 2016}}</ref>
==Controversy== He was one of the accused in a corruption case regarding the procurement of [[MiG-29]] for [[Bangladesh Air Force]] along with other government officials including Bangladesh Prime Minister [[Sheikh Hasina]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ex-army chief gets bail in MiG-29 case|url=http://bdnews24.com/politics/2008/05/28/ex-army-chief-gets-bail-in-mig-29-case|website=bdnews24.com|accessdate=19 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Ex-Bangladesh PM faces court action|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/2705905.stm|website=news.bbc.co.uk|publisher=British Broadcasting Corporaton|accessdate=19 February 2016}}</ref>
